title: Smallest sample to estimate mean dinner cost

content.prompt: A large city newspaper periodically reports the mean cost of dinner for two people at restaurants in the city. The newspaper staff will collect data from a random sample of restaurants in the city and estimate the mean price using a 90 percent confidence interval. In past years, the standard deviation has always been very close to $35. Assuming that the population standard deviation is $35, which of the following is the minimum sample size needed to obtain a margin of error of no more than $5 ?

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
